item.title: 美股创纪录反弹走高，盈利成为焦点
item.description: 美股破纪录的涨势在周四继续走高，投资者对科技重镇 Alphabet 公司的财报欢呼雀跃，即使同为 "华丽七巨头 "的特斯拉公司（Tesla Inc.【原文：A record-breaking rally in US stocks continued to grind higher on Thursday, with investors cheering earnings from tech-heavyweight Alphabet Inc. even as fellow Magnificent Seven member Tesla Inc. delivered a gloomy outlook.】

item.title: 美国 6 月新房销售增幅低于预期
item.description: 6 月份，美国新房销售依然疲软，原因是建筑商更多地采用销售激励措施，但未能刺激因成本高昂而望而却步的购房者。【原文：Sales of new homes in the US remained weak in June as builders’ heavier use of sales incentives failed to motivate buyers put off by high costs.】

item.title: 长期不受青睐的核能正在卷土重来
item.description: 核电长期以来一直在走下坡路，其在世界发电量中所占的比例从 20 世纪 90 年代中期的 18% 降至现在的 9%，减少了一半。现在有了复苏的迹象。【原文：Nuclear power has long been on the decline, its share of the world’s electricity generation halving from 18% in the mid-1990s to 9% today. Now there are signs of a revival.】

item.title: 美国服务业商业活动创今年最快增速
item.description: 由于服务业的增长抵消了制造业的萎缩，美国 7 月份的商业活动以今年以来最快的速度增长。【原文：US business activity expanded in July at the fastest rate this year as a strengthening in services more than offset a contraction in manufacturing.】

item.title: 英国石油公司计划退出价值 360 亿澳元的澳大利亚绿色氢气项目
item.description: 英国石油公司（BP Plc）将退出计划在澳大利亚建设的大规模绿色氢气生产设施，因为这家英国石油巨头将重新专注于推动其利润增长的化石燃料。【原文：BP Plc will exit its role in a massive green hydrogen production facility planned in Australia as the British oil major refocuses on the fossil fuels that drive its profits.】

item.title: 西班牙英德拉公司瞄准无人机交易扩大武器部门
item.description: Indra Sistemas SA 公司首席执行官表示，该公司正在寻求潜在收购，以发展以国防为重点的无人机业务。【原文：Indra Sistemas SA is eying a potential acquisition to develop a defense-focused drone business, its chief executive said.】

item.title: 俄罗斯乌斯季卢加港在神秘爆炸事件后下令检查船只
item.description: 俄罗斯波罗的海最大的港口乌斯季卢加港坚持要求在允许船只进入该港口之前对船体进行检查，这表明前往俄罗斯的油轮发生的一系列神秘爆炸事件正在影响该国的商品贸易。【原文：Ust-Luga, Russia’s largest port in the Baltic Sea, is insisting that ships’ hulls are inspected before the vessels are allowed to enter the facility, a sign of how a string of mystery blasts involving tankers that went to Russia are affecting the nation’s commodity trade.】

item.title: 欧洲太阳能发电增长将出现 2016 年以来的首次下滑
item.description: 由于批发电价降低，对屋顶太阳能电池板的需求减弱，欧盟一连串创纪录的太阳能发电部署将在今年结束。【原文：The European Union’s string of record-setting solar power deployment is on track to come to an end this year as demand wanes for rooftop solar panels due to lower wholesale electricity prices.】

item.title: 葡萄牙任命佩雷拉为中央银行行长，接替森特诺
item.description: 葡萄牙政府提名阿尔瓦罗-桑托斯-佩雷拉（Alvaro Santos Pereira）担任央行行长，接替仅连任一届的欧元区最鸽派利率制定者之一。【原文：The Portuguese government nominated Alvaro Santos Pereira to head the central bank, replacing one of the euro area’s most dovish interest rate-setters after just one term.】

item.title: 德意志银行策略师称市场几乎热得难以驾驭
item.description: 德意志银行（Deutsche Bank AG）的信贷策略师表示，美国的保证金债务--一种显示投资者为在纽约证券交易所购买股票而借贷金额的指标--开始变得过热；这对信贷市场来说是一个潜在的危险信号。【原文：US margin debt, a measure showing how much investors are borrowing to buy stocks on the New York Stock Exchange, is starting to run too hot — a potentially concerning sign for the credit market, according to credit strategists at Deutsche Bank AG.】

item.title: 天气风险加剧供应担忧，阿拉比卡咖啡价格上涨
item.description: 阿拉比卡咖啡连续第三天上涨，原因是人们越来越担心头号种植国巴西的供应问题，交易商正在监测作物产量，因为潮湿的天气有可能导致收成放缓。【原文：Arabica coffee rose for a third day on mounting worries over supplies from top-grower Brazil, as traders monitor crop yields amid the risk of wet weather slowing the harvest.】

item.title: 财务状况改善，S&P 上调巴基斯坦评级
item.description: S&P全球评级公司（S&P Global Ratings）上调了巴基斯坦的信用评级，理由是巴基斯坦政府为促进这个南亚国家的经济所做的努力中，金融状况有所改善。【原文：S&P Global Ratings upgraded Pakistan’s credit rating, citing better financial conditions in a boost for the government’s efforts to bolster the South Asian country’s economy.】

item.title: HarbourVest 聘请贝莱德高管领导财富管理业务
item.description: HarbourVest Partners 聘请了贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc.【原文：HarbourVest Partners has hired an executive from BlackRock Inc. to boost its offerings for wealthy individuals, an area of increasing focus in the sector as some institutional investors pare their private equity holdings.】

item.title: 道达尔公司称，柴油因制裁和错误的石油种类而飙升
item.description: 欧洲最大炼油商的老板说，欧盟限制进口俄罗斯燃料的措施和轻质原油供应量的激增正在推动全球柴油价格上涨。【原文：European Union measures to restrict imports of Russian fuel and surging supplies of lighter crude are driving diesel up prices across the world, the boss of Europe’s largest oil refiner said.】

item.title: 美国申请失业救济人数连续第六周下降，创四月中旬以来新低
item.description: 美国失业救济金申请人数连续第六周下降，凸显了劳动力市场的韧性。【原文：Applications for US unemployment benefits fell for a sixth straight week, underscoring the resilience of the labor market.】

item.title: 汽车行业下滑，加拿大消费支出失去动力
item.description: 加拿大零售销售额显示出消费者消费疲软的警示信号，他们可能越来越担心物价上涨和就业前景。【原文：Canadian retail sales are flashing a warning sign of weaker spending by consumers who may be increasingly worried about rising prices and their job prospects.】

item.title: 全球供应强劲，巴黎小麦下跌
item.description: 巴黎小麦期货因全球供应强劲以及欧洲出口商面临激烈的价格竞争而下跌。【原文：Paris wheat futures fell on the outlook for robust global supplies, and as European exporters face intense price competition.】

item.title: 欧洲垃圾贷款市场出现罕见的投资者疲劳迹象
item.description: 放款人要求两家欧洲杠杆贷款借款人提高定价，这在如今繁荣的次投资级债务市场中是罕见的困难迹象。【原文：Lenders are demanding higher pricing from two European leveraged-loan borrowers, a rare sign of difficulty these days in the buoyant market for sub-investment grade debt.】

item.title: 欧洲央行维持利率不变，等待美国关税政策明朗化
item.description: 在通胀率达到 2% 之后，欧洲中央银行一年多来首次维持利率不变，而与美国的混乱贸易谈判继续给经济蒙上阴影。【原文：The European Central Bank kept interest rates unchanged for the first time in more than a year after inflation hit 2% and messy trade negotiations with the US continued to cast a shadow over the economy.】

item.title: 墨西哥年度通胀放缓，为新一轮降息打开空间
item.description: 墨西哥 7 月初的年度通胀放缓幅度超过预期，支持了墨西哥央行在上月降息后进一步放宽政策的决定。【原文：Mexico’s annual inflation slowed more than expected in early July, supporting the central bank’s decision to leave the door open to further easing after last month’s interest rate cut.】

item.title: 动物饲料需求带动拖拉机供应销售增长创两年新高
item.description: 由于牲畜饲料需求稳定，加上大宗采购的积极势头，Tractor Supply Co.【原文：Tractor Supply Co. rose after posting its best sales growth in two years as steady demand for its livestock feed, coupled with positive momentum in big-ticket purchases, lifted results above expectations.】

item.title: 塞尔维亚将在国内囤积所有黄金，避开全球枢纽
item.description: 塞尔维亚中央银行计划将其所有黄金储备转移到本国境内，以确保危机时期囤积黄金的安全。【原文：Serbia’s central bank plans to bring all of its gold reserves onto its own soil to ensure the security of the hoard in periods of crisis.】

item.title: 欧盟的新制裁可能成为打击莫斯科原油运输的第一波力量
item.description:
集团关注俄罗斯的出口规模，而不仅仅是价值，这将影响炼油厂的业务。【原文：

The bloc’s focus on the size of Russia’s exports and not just the value will ripple through the refinery business.

】

item.title: 医疗技术公司肩负创新寻求 1.05 亿美元 IPO
item.description: 随着美国股市持续反弹，Shoulder Innovations Inc.【原文：Shoulder Innovations Inc. is seeking to raise as much as $105 million in an initial public offering, as US listings continue to rebound.】

item.title: 据称 JD.com 即将决定是否收购德国 Ceconomy
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，中国电子商务公司京东商城（JD.com Inc.【原文：Chinese e-commerce firm JD.com Inc. is nearing a decision on a bid to acquire German electronics retailer Ceconomy AG, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 雀巢跌跌撞撞，利洁时突飞猛进，CEO们力促增长
item.description: 世界上最大的两家消费品公司的首席执行官正在收回他们的前任所下的赌注，放弃品牌以刺激增长。【原文：The chief executives of two of the world’s biggest consumer goods companies are walking back soured bets by their predecessors, shedding brands in an effort to spur growth.】

item.title: 今年夏天外国游客不去美国，零售旅游业出现短缺
item.description: 我是驻纽约的美国经济记者奥古斯塔-萨拉瓦。今天我们关注零售旅游业。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net。如果您还没有注册，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Augusta Saraiva, a US economy reporter in New York. Today we’re looking at retail tourism. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.】

item.title: Meta 引发人工智能人才 "淘金热"，以 "理性 "赢得竞争
item.description: 欢迎收看《深度科技》（Tech In Depth），这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日时事通讯。今天，库尔特-瓦格纳（Kurt Wagner）想知道，大型科技公司花费数百万美元聘请人工智能研究人员究竟有多理性。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Kurt Wagner wonders just how rational it is for Big Tech companies to spend millions to hire artificial intelligence researchers.】

item.title: 土耳其中央银行降息幅度超出预期
item.description: 土耳其央行自 3 月份以来首次大幅降息，恢复了因反对派重要人物被捕而引发的政治危机所导致的降息周期。【原文：Turkey’s central bank delivered a sizable interest-rate cut for the first time since March, resuming a reduction cycle that was derailed by a political crisis stemming from the arrest of a leading opposition figure.】

item.title: 乌克兰央行维持利率不变，政府寻求更多 IMF 援助
item.description: 在乌克兰政府准备与国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）进行新的贷款谈判之际，乌克兰中央银行保持基准利率稳定，而最近针对反腐机构的行动加剧了捐助方的担忧。【原文：Ukraine’s central bank held its benchmark interest rate steady as the government prepares for new loan talks with the International Monetary Fund, with recent moves against anti-corruption agencies fueling donor concerns.】
